document-response.digital-image: Digital Image - The document you uploaded cannot be verified. Kindly submit a photograph of the physical document via the "Documents" tab which can be located in the menu on the left-hand side of your account.
document-response.email-sent: Email Sent - Kindly note that an email was sent to you from our respective department regarding your accounts verification and what is needed in order to complete it. Please reply to us at your earliest convenience. Thank you.
document-response.incomplete: Incomplete - To complete your identity verification please go to the "Documents" tab on the left-hand side menu, to manually upload your Proof of Identity document, Proof of Address document and a Verification Selfie.
document-response.live-selfie: Live Selfie - In order to complete your KYC Verification, we kindly request that you upload a Real-Time Selfie by accessing the "Documents" tab from your account. Kindly ensure that your full face is visible and that it is a live selfie and not a previously saved image.
document-response.password-protected: Password Protected - The document you have uploaded is password protected. Please go to the "Documents" tab on the left-hand side menu, to manually upload the document again - unprotected.
document-response.verified-successfully: Verified - Your account has been successfully verified, meaning we do not need any further documents. Thank you.
document-response.alternative-submit-different-document: Alternative - We were unable to verify the document you have submitted as proof of identity. Kindly submit a different document that is acceptable like: Passport, National ID Card, Driver's License or Permanent Residency Card. This together with a Verification Selfie.
document-response.backside: Backside - We require both sides of card documents in order to proceed. Kindly submit a photo of the backside of this identification document by accessing the "Documents" tab from your account.
document-response.backside-and-selfie: Backside + Selfie - We require a picture of both sides of the card document, as well as a verification selfie, in order to proceed. Kindly submit a photo of the backside of this identification document by accessing the "Documents" tab from your account.
document-response.standards-for-clarity: Clarity - The document provided does not meet standards for legibility and clarity. Kindly ensure the image provided is clear and shows the full document (4 corners visible) and all information without obstruction or light reflection. You can submit a new copy by accessing the Documents tab from your account.
document-response.covered-info: Covered info - Kindly provide us with a document that is showing all details clearly and no data are covered. To verify your identity, you we will need to upload front and backside of the document as well as a verification selfie by accessing the "Documents" tab from your account.
document-response.damaged: Damaged - Your identity document is damaged so cannot be used to verify your account. Kindly provide a suitable alternative like: Passport, National ID Card, Driver's License or Permanent Residency Card.
document-response.expired: Expired - The document provided seems to have expired. Kindly submit an image of an identification document that is not expired.
document-response.expired-and-selfie: Expired + Selfie - The document provided seems to have expired. Kindly submit an image of an identification document (front and backside) that is not expired. This together with a Verification Selfie.
document-response.expired-soon: Expired Soon - We noticed that your Identification document is soon to expire. We suggest to provide an alternative document (passport, ID card, driver's licence) in order to ensure your account will remain fully verified in the near future.
document-response.frontside-selfie: Frontside + Selfie - We require a picture of both sides (front and back) of the card document, as well as a verification selfie, in order to proceed. Kindly submit those documents by accessing the "Documents" tab from your account.
document-response.mismatch-name: Mismatch Name - We noticed that the name on your ID document does not match the one registered on your account. Please do not be alarmed, your account security is very important for us, so in order to complete the account verification, please assist us with an explanation of why the data does not match. Contact our live chat for further help or send us your explanation here. Thank you.
document-response.mismatch-db: Mismatch DoB - We noticed that the date of birth on your ID document does not match the one registered on your account. Please do not be alarmed, your account security is very important for us, so in order to complete the account verification, please assist us with an explanation of why the data does not match. Contact our live chat for further help or send us your explanation here. Thank you.
document-response.nimc: NIMC - As you do not have any other form of identification document, we will be able to approve your ID paper slip. To proceed, kindly provide us with a backside of this paper slip, your birth certificate as well as a photo of yourself - selfie.
document-response.not-full: Not Full - The image uploaded does not show the full document. Kindly submit a copy image of the document showing all 4 corners by accessing the "Documents" tab from your account.
document-response.not-full-and-selfie: Not Full + Selfie - The image uploaded does not show the full document. Kindly submit a copy image of the document showing all 4 corners together with a verification selfie by accessing the "Documents"tab from your account.
document-response.not-full-and-backside-and-selfie: Not Full + Backside + Selfie - The image uploaded does not show the full document. Kindly submit a copy image of the document showing all 4 corners together with a backside and a verification selfie by accessing the "Documents" tab from your account.
document-response.paper-id: Paper ID - Paper ID's are not an acceptable form of identification. Kindly submit a different document that is acceptable like: Passport, National ID Card, Driver's license or Permanent residency card.
document-response.passport-unsigned: Passport Unsigned - Please make sure that the uploaded document has the bearer signature visible. Kindly submit a photo of your document by accessing the Documents tab from your account.
document-response.passport-full: Passport Full - The image uploaded does not show the full document. Please make sure that the uploaded document has the bearer signature and both pages visible. Kindly submit a photo of your document by accessing the "Documents" tab from your account.
document-response.poi-verified-and-poa-missing: POI Verified, Missing POA - Your identity document has been approved, we don't require any more forms of ID from you. Please provide us with a Proof of Address document by clicking the Documents tab on the menu on the left-hand side. This will complete your account verification.
document-response.poi-verified: POI Verified - We do not require any further identity documents as we have already verified your ID, thank you.
document-response.requirements: Requirements - Please make sure that the uploaded document meets the following requirements: it is government issued, it is not expired, has the bearer signature visible, contains your full name, shows your date of birth and your picture, is clear, is uploaded with a verification selfie.
document-response.scan: Scan - We are unable to verify the document you provided as we do not accept scans. Please provide a digital photo of the physical document by accessing the Documents tab via your account. If you are submitting an ID card or driver's license, we require pictures of both the front and backside.
document-response.scan-and-selfie: Scan + Selfie - We are unable to verify the document you provided as we do not accept scans. Please provide a digital photo of the physical document by accessing the Documents tab via your account. If you are submitting an ID card or driver's license, we require pictures of both the front and backside as well as a verification selfie.
document-response.screenshot: Screenshot - We are unable to verify the document you provided as we do not accept screenshots. Please provide a digital photo of the physical document (front and backside) as well as a verification selfie by accessing the Documents tab via your account.
document-response.poa-90-days: 90 Days - Please submit a proof of address document that is not older than 90 days by accessing the Documents tab from your account.
document-response.account-address: Account Address - We noticed that the address on your account is missing/is not full. Kindly contact our support team in order to change your address accordingly.
document-response.alternative-utility-bil-or-bank-statemen: Alternative - Please submit one of the following documents: Utility bill or Bank statement. Please make sure that the uploaded document meets the following requirements: Issued within 90 days, contains your full name, contains your registered address and all 4 corners are visible.
document-response.bank-notice: Bank Notice - Please submit one of the following documents: Utility bill or Bank statement. Bank notice letters, unfortunately, cannot be accepted only bank statements showing your accounts activity. Thank you.
document-response.clarity: Clarity - The document provided does not meet standards for legibility and clarity. Kindly ensure the image provided is clear and shows all information without obstruction or light reflection. You can submit a new copy by accessing the Documents tab from your account.
document-response.edited: Edited - Kindly provide us with a document that is not digitally edited. If you would like to cover any sensitive details, please use a piece of paper to truncate the information.
document-response.letter: Letter - Please submit photo of the actual document as envelopes, unfortunately, cannot be accepted. Kindly submit a photo of the document showing all 4 corners by accessing the "Documents" tab from your account.
document-response.mismatch-name-2: Mismatch Name - We noticed that the name on the provided document does not match the one registered on your account. Please do not be alarmed, your account security is very important for us, so in order to complete the account verification please assist us with an explanation of why the data does not match. You can send the explanation here, or get in touch via Live chat. Thank you.
document-response.mismatch-address: Mismatch Address - We noticed that the address on the provided document does not match the one registered in your account. Please do not be alarmed, your account security is very important for us, so in order to complete the account verification please assist us with an explanation of why the data does not match. Contact our live chat for further help or send us your explanation here. Thank you.
document-response.missing-poa: Missing POA - To complete your account verification please go to the "Documents" tab on the left-hand side menu, to manually upload your Proof of Address document.
document-response.online-bank: Online Bank - We could not verify the document you provided as we cannot accept statements from online banks. Please upload an alternative bank statement or a utility bill, paystub, credit card statement or mobile contract bill.
document-response.pdf-or-photo: PDF/Photo - The proof of address document you uploaded cannot be verified. You can upload the full PDF document or a photograph of the physical document via the Documents tab which can be located in the menu on the left-hand side of your account.
document-response.poa-verified-and-poi-missing: POA Verified, Missing POI - No further documents for proof of address are required. To complete your accounts verification please go to the "Documents" tab on the left-hand side menu, to manually upload your Proof of identity document and a verification selfie.
document-response.poa-verified: POA Verified - Your address has been successfully verified, meaning we do not need any further proof of address documents. Thank you.
document-response.po-box: PO Box - Please provide us with a bank statement or utility bill, dated no longer than 3 months ago, that states your home address rather than your PO Box address. Thank you.
document-response.requirements-2: Requirements - Please make sure that the uploaded document meets the following requirements: Issued within 90 days, contains your full name, contains your registered address and all 4 corners are visible.

symbol-description.cryptos-adausd: Cardano (ADA) is one of the fastest growing blockchain assets in the entire cryptocurrency industry. It stands out form other competing blockchains due to its use of mathematical principles in its consensus mechanism and a unique multi-layer architecture. Cardano's market capitalization has grown to over $66 billion. And is hailed as the Ethereum-killer. Traders have benefited from a good return on investment since it was launched in 2015.
symbol-description.cryptos-avausd: Designed to be scalable, Avalanche is on par with the top payment processors in the world (VISA and Paypal) and offers 4,500 transactions per second (TPS). Built with the aim of serving financial markets, it has great potential for its future. Its native token AVAX ensures high transaction security coupled with speed scaling a trillion per second. This coin is set to shake things up in the crypto industry with several traders choosing to jump in now that it is set to grow even further.
symbol-description.cryptos-dotusd: The new kid on the block, Polkadot was created by Ethereum co-founder Gavin Wood. It was created with a different goal in mind, that of connecting and securing unique blockchains. This crypto's vision to Polkadot appears poised to continue its mission of developing a blockchain network that operates in a trustless fashion for verifying data and value transfers in its quest for a decentralized internet. Its recent price rallies, reaching new all-time highs saw investors profiting from this coin, solidifying its presence within the industry.
symbol-description.cryptos-shbusd1000: Shiba Inu (SHIBUSD) is an Ethereum-based altcoin that was created way back in 2010 by an individual or group called Ryoshi. Widely regarded as the alternative to Dogecoin, it is created and hosted by the Ethereum blockchain. The coin's price has recently surged by x1000, giving it a market capitalization of $35 billion and ranking it 10th among all cryptocurrencies (as at end of October 2021). This makes it a very attractive usable asset due to its low entry point and possibilities for profitable returns.
symbol-description.cryptos-solusd: Solana is one of the fastest growing cryptos found in the industry at the moment. This crypto, created in 2017, focuses on high-performing and fast transactions. In the year 2021, the coin has experienced monumental growth jumping from $1.50 in January 2021 to more than $208 (as at September 2021). It can handle more transactions per second than Ethereum, making its fees extremely low. All this continues to skyrocket its value higher, opening new benefits for Solana investors.
symbol-description.currencies-audcad: The AUDCAD pair is one of the pairs with lower volumes of trading and relatively low volatility. The AUDCAD exchange rate represents the link between Australia and Canada. These countries are responsible for the global supply of raw materials.
symbol-description.currencies-audchf: The AUDCHF pair reflects the economic relationship between Australia and Switzerland. The currency cross pair is defined with lower trade volumes and medium levels of volatility.
symbol-description.currencies-audjpy: The AUDJPY is one of the more popular cross currency pairs as it tracks the price of the Australian dollar against the Japanese Yen, two large economies with important export functions.
symbol-description.currencies-audnzd: The AUDNZD pair is one of the preferred cross currency pairs in the foreign exchange marketplace. The AUDNZD, also known as Aussie/Kiwi is famous for its high volatility as both currencies are considered risk-on.
symbol-description.currencies-audusd: The AUDUSD currency pair is one of the pairs with average volatility levels and large volumes in the markets. The AUDUSD pair is considered to be commodity driven as both Australia and the United States are involved in the production of large quantities of raw materials such as Gold and other metals.
symbol-description.currencies-batusd: Utilizing the Ethereum blockchain and web browser known as Brave, the Basic Attention Token (BAT) is a new token that can be used as cryptocurrency. Designed on the advertising notion of user attention, this currency is designed to be exchanged between advertisers, publishers and users. Its success is steadily climbing as it reached an impressive all-time high in March, 2021, closing above $1 for the first time. The Brave browser, on which this crypto operates, continues to host an estimated 25.4 million monthly active users and almost 10 million users daily. This pushes BAT's market capitalization where it operates at approximately $1.4 billion.
symbol-description.currencies-bchusd: A fork of crypto powerhouse Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash aims to provide a better scalability and more transactions to be processed in a shorter time. This currency proved itself as a great investment as it managed to rank 5th in market capitalization in just two years. As of April 2021, the daily trading volume exceeds $1 billion showing huge credibility in this innovative cryptocurrency.
symbol-description.currencies-bnbusd: Operating on the Ethereum blockchain, Binance Coin is used as payment for the fees associated with trading on the Binance Exchange, giving the traders who use it the advantage of trading at a discount. On 2nd April BNC set a new all-time high of 365.78, consolidating its position as one of the best up and coming cryptocurrencies.
symbol-description.currencies-btcusd: BTCUSD represents the exchange of Bitcoin for US dollars. Developed in 2009, Bitcoin is the first and currently the most valuable cryptocurrency, defining the new asset class of cryptocurrencies. Bitcoin runs on the blockchain technology and its main features include decentralization, low fees and anonymity.
symbol-description.currencies-cadchf: The CADCHF pair is characterized by low trading volumes which is reflected in a rather calm price dynamic. Most of the time, the pair is trading with low volatility resulting in the formation of sideway trends.
symbol-description.currencies-cadjpy: The CADJPY pair defines the economic relationship between Canada and Japan. The currency cross between the Canadian dollar and the Japanese Yen is famous for its rather high volumes of trading and increased volatility during the most active trading hours.
symbol-description.currencies-cadsgd: The pair CADSGD is considered an exotic pair. It is characterized by low liquidity and rather low daily transaction volumes. It represents the exchange rate between the currencies of Canada and Singapore.
symbol-description.currencies-chfjpy: The CHFJPY pair links two of the most stable economies, the Swiss and the Japanese economy. Both currencies are considered safe havens in the financial market. The trends in the CHFJPY pair tend to last for months, even years.
symbol-description.currencies-dashusd: The DASHUSD represents the exchange of Dash for US dollars. Dash is in the top 30 cryptocurrencies and dates back to 2014. The name comes from "digital cash" and it was created as a fork of Litecoin, also a very popular cryptocurrency.
symbol-description.currencies-dogeusd: The Doge coin epitomizes the success of a good joke. It was created by Billy Markus and Jackson Palmer with the aim of transforming the Doge internet meme into a cryptocurrency back in 2013. It grew its popularity via social media due to its high supply and low price, making it instantly accessible. It is also faster than other blockchains due to its 1-minute block intervals, deriving from Luckycoin which forked from Litecoin. The coin can keep inflating indefinitely as there is no cap to the supply of coins.
symbol-description.currencies-edousd: EDOUSD is the exchange rate of Eidoo cryptocurrency for US dollars. Eidoo is a cryptocurrency founded in 2017 as a multicurrency crypto platform.
symbol-description.currencies-eosusd: EOS versus the US dollar represents a a smart contract platform that claims to eliminate transaction fees plus allowing millions of transactions per second. EOS awards itself with having the most powerful infrastructure for decentralized applications, enabling the development,hosting and execution of commercial-scale dApps on its platform.
symbol-description.currencies-etcusd: Born as a result of a 2016 network hack, Ethereum Classic is an open-source, blockchain-based distributed cryptocurrency platform that runs smart contracts. ETC has 116 million coins in circulation with a market capitalization of nearly $1.3 billion. As of March 2021, ETC trades at nearly $11. Its creators continue working on being a digital store value that can be exchanged and saved while maintaining its value.
symbol-description.currencies-ethusd: Growing in popularity, Ether is currently the second largest cryptocurrency behind Bitcoin. First launched in 2015, Ethereum is a smart contract focused digital asset, a currency, and a mainframe all in one. Like Bitcoin, Ethereum is built on blockchain technology. The blockchain protocol itself is Ethereum however Ether (ETH) is the altcoin that serves the blockchain.
symbol-description.currencies-euraud: The EURAUD pair links the trading activity between the economies of the Eurozone and Australia. As both currencies are considered "major", trading in this pair is affected by overall global economic conditions, adjustable and fluid monetary policy and the liquidity of the commodity market.
symbol-description.currencies-eurcad: The EURCAD pair is one of the major currency pairs in the global financial markets. Its considered a cross currency pair since it does not include the US dollar. The EURCAD is one of the lightweight currency pairings with daily transaction volumes in the forex market of 0.3%.
symbol-description.currencies-eurchf: The EURCHF pair is a cross pair since it does not include the US dollar and comprises of 0.9% of the daily transaction volumes in the financial market. A rather popular pair, the EURCHF is also called Euro-Swissy.
symbol-description.currencies-eurczk: EURCZK is the exchange rate of the currencies of the Eurozone and the Czech Koruna. The EURCZK is an exotic pair with low volatility and fluctuations in a rather calm trading environment.
symbol-description.currencies-eurdkk: EURDKK is a pair linking the Eurozone currency to the Danish krone. The pair is characterized by a calm trading mood and trends with low levels of volatility.
symbol-description.currencies-eurgbp: The EURGBP pair is one of the most exchanged currency pairs. Considered a major pair, the EURGBP pairs the United Kingdom with the Eurozone. EURGBP is also called the Chunnel, an abbreviation of the Channel Tunnel that links England to France (Europe).
symbol-description.currencies-eurhkd: EURHKD is a currency rate pairing the economies of the Eurozone and Hong Kong. Generally, the pair is trading with low volumes and low levels of liquidity.
symbol-description.currencies-eurhuf: The Euro Hungarian currency pair is a contrasting pair given its characteristics are high volatility and low liquidity. However, it is very easy to predict and that makes it an asset for some trading depending on their scenario. The Euro currency is a currency used by 19 European countries and is a favourite for traders due to its high liquidity and predictability. The Hungarian forint is the national currency used in Hungary and is influenced by the economy of this country. Due to an influx of foreign investment in this country, traders have recently begun paying attention to this currency pair.
symbol-description.currencies-eurjpy: The pairing of the Euro and the Japanese Yen accounts for one of the largest daily trading volumes in the currency marketplace. The currency pairing defines the trading activity between the EU countries and Japan, an export-oriented country. The pair is also called Yuppy.
symbol-description.currencies-eurnok: EURNOK is defined as an exotic cross currency and is characterized by lower levels of daily transaction volumes with a rather calm manner of trading in the medium to long-term.
symbol-description.currencies-eurnzd: The EURNZD pair is considered to be one of the most volatile pairs in the currency market.  With one of the highest ranges of daily fluctuation, the EURNZD is most active during the Pacific and European session.
symbol-description.currencies-eurpln: The EURPLN pair is the rate between the currency of the Eurozone and the native currency of Poland, the Polish Zloty. It trades with low daily volumes and medium volatility.
symbol-description.currencies-eursek: The EURSEK pair links the currencies of the Eurozone and Sweden. The pair is trading with relatively low levels of liquidity and low transaction volumes.
symbol-description.currencies-eursgd: The Euro currency versus the Singaporean Dollar is quite a specific pair given it has no direct correlation. The Singaporean dollar is influenced by the commercial and industrial turnover of Singapore while the euro is mostly tied to the decisions made by the European Central Bank. As most specific pairs, its performance is characteristic when distinct fluctuations occur, and this is where investors can pocket profits. When trading, bear in mind that the Euro is mostly affected by the main donor countries that are Germany (primary donor), followed by Italy and France.
symbol-description.currencies-eurtry: The EURTRY is a cross currency pair characterized by significantly high daily fluctuations and relatively high volume levels. The pair links the single European currency and the Turkish lira.
symbol-description.currencies-eurusd: The EURUSD pair is the most liquid and most traded pair in the market with the largest volumes. It connects the economies of the Eurozone and the United states. The EURUSD is also called Fiber, from the pure cotton fiber paper of euro banknotes.
symbol-description.currencies-eurzar: The EURZAR pair is classified as a cross currency rate between the Euro and the South African Rand. The pair is affected by the economic developments both in the EU and South Africa.
symbol-description.currencies-gbpaud: The GBPAUD pair is a cross currency pair defined by large daily transaction volumes and high volatility. Price dymanics can be sharp and rather unpredictable.
symbol-description.currencies-gbpcad: The GBPCAD is a cross currency pair between the Great British Pound and the Canadian Dollar. GBPCAD is characterized by high daily volumes and quick movements to both sides.
symbol-description.currencies-gbpchf: The GBPCHF pair has highly volatile behavior as it is generally accepted as one of the pairs with a choppier style of trading that is sensitive to economic data and political developments.
symbol-description.currencies-gbpdkk: The GBPDKK pair represents the exchange rate between the Great British pound and the Danish krone. It is a pair with low daily transaction volumes and medium levels of volatility.
symbol-description.currencies-gbpjpy: The pairing of the British pound and the Japanese yen has one of the highest levels of volatility in the currency market, hence the nickname "the dragon". The pair is a cross pair, for the US dollar is not used in the exchange. The pair is allso called Guppy.
symbol-description.currencies-gbpnok: The GBPNOK links the currencies of the United Kingdom and Norway. It is classified as an exotic cross currency and it is characterized by relatively low transaction volumes and a rather steady trading pace.
symbol-description.currencies-gbpnzd: The GBPNZD is one of the major currency cross pairs. The rate between the Great British Pound and the New Zealand Dollar is defined with  dynamics that are usually volatile and the price may move a lot in a short period of time.
symbol-description.currencies-gbpsek: The GBPSEK pair is the exchange rate between the Great British pound and the Swedish krona. The pair is relatively calm and collected in its price action with a relaxed trading style.
symbol-description.currencies-gbpusd: The GBPUSD pair has one of the largest volumes of daily transactions in the currency market. GBPUSD also goes by the nickname “Cable” since in 1858, a cable under the Atlantic was laid and was used to telegraph GBP and USD from London to New York.
symbol-description.currencies-iotausd: This pair represents IOTA versus the US dollar. IOTA is an open-source distributed ledger and cryptocurrency designed for the internet of things, motivated by a potentially higher scalability over blockchain based distributed ledgers, IOTA uses a directed acyclic graph to store transactions on its ledge. It's design is meant to support frictionless data and value transfer.
symbol-description.currencies-ltcusd: LTCUSD represents the exchange rate of Litecoin to US dollar. Litecoin is in the top 10 most valuable cryptocurrencies and it is one of the oldest ones, founded in 2011.
symbol-description.currencies-neousd: The NEOUSD pair is one of the top crypto/dollar pairs. NEO is a top 30 cryptocurrency that serves as an ecosystem for digital payments, identities and assets.
symbol-description.currencies-nzdcad: The NZDCAD pair is one of the major cross rates. It is considered to be a commodity currency pair as both New Zealand and Canada are strongly focused on exporting raw materials.
symbol-description.currencies-nzdchf: The NZDCHF pair usually trades at lower liquidity levels while at the same time price dynamics is highly volatile. The pair reflects the relationship between New Zealand and Switzerland.
symbol-description.currencies-nzdjpy: The NZDJPY pair is traded with relatively low volumes and an average level of volatility. Being a cross currency pair, NZDJPY usually trades in a calm manner with range trading not unfamiliar.
symbol-description.currencies-nzdusd: The NZDUSD pair is one of the popular currency pairs to be traded in the financial markets. It is considered a commodity pair as its value is related to agricultural products, specifically diary products. NZD goes by the name Kiwi, the national symbol of New Zealand.
symbol-description.currencies-omgusd: OMGUSD reflects the exchange rate between OMG and the US dollar. OMG is a cryptocurrency built for the Ethereum blockchain. OMG is in the top 40 most valuable cryptocurrencies.
symbol-description.currencies-sanusd: The SANUSD pair represents the ratio between SAN and the US dollar. Santiment was created as a cryptocurrency platform for financial market data.
symbol-description.currencies-trxusd: Since its inception in 2017, Tron has truly surpassed expectations as it climbed to the top 10 cryptocurrencies in the world, in terms of market capitalization. It is truly more impressive keeping in mind that it managed to do this in a mere two years. Tron has zero transaction fees. This means you can send a large amount of funds to the other side of the world without paying any fees. The funds will also arrive within seconds given the platform can process 2000 transactions per second. These are two remarkable feats that set this currency apart from its competitors in the industry.
symbol-description.currencies-usdcad: The USDCAD is one of the major pairings in the currency markets and one of the most frequently traded. The USDCAD is considered a commodity pair, as it reflects value changes in energy commodities such as crude oil and natural gas. The Canadian dollar is also called the Loonie.
symbol-description.currencies-usdchf: The pairing of the US dollar with the Swiss Franc accounts for some of the largest trading volumes in the forex market. One of the major pairs, the USDCHF represents the strong trade activity between the United States and Switzerland. The CHF is considered a safe haven among currencies.
symbol-description.currencies-usdcnh: The USDCNH pair reflects the quoting of the US dollar against the Chinese Yuan. The top two economies by GDP, USA and China, have their currency exchange rate trading in long-term trends with medium levels of daily volumes.
symbol-description.currencies-usdczk: The USDCZK represents the exchange rate between the currencies of the United States and the Czech Republic. It is characterized by low levels of volatility and low transaction volumes.
symbol-description.currencies-usddkk: The USDDKK is the pair linking the economies of the United States and Denmark. The pair is classified as an exotic cross currency pair and is defined by high volatility and relatively low volumes of trading.
symbol-description.currencies-usdhkd: The USDHKD pair is the exchange rate between the US dollar and the Hong Kong dollar. The pair is mostly active during the Asian trading session and is characterized by low volumes and medium levels of volatility.
symbol-description.currencies-usdhuf: The USDHUF defines the exchange rate between the US dollar, the base currency, and the Hungarian forint, the quoted currency. The pair is characterized with low daily volumes and a calm manner of trading.
symbol-description.currencies-usdils: The USDILS represents the exchange rate between the US dollar and the Israeli shekel. The pair is charactereized by low trading volumes and price stability with clearly defined trends in the medium to long-term.
symbol-description.currencies-usdjpy: The USDJPY pair is one of the most important and heavily traded currency pairs. Also known as the Ninja, the pair is an important benchmark of the economic relationship between the USA and Japan. The JPY has a reputation as a safe haven in the currency market.
symbol-description.currencies-usdmxn: The currency pairing of the US dollar and the Mexican peso is one of the most heavily traded currencies in the emerging market space. The USD/MXN pair is considered one of the exotic pairs. In 2016 it became popular as the Trump Trade for its high volatility during and after the US election.
symbol-description.currencies-usdnok: The USDNOK currency pair quotes the exchange rate between the US dollar the Norwegian krone. Considered an exotic, the pair has relatively low liquidity and is affected by the price of energy products as Norway is the largest exporter of oil and gas in Western Europe.
symbol-description.currencies-usdpln: The USDPLN represents the exchange rate between the US dollar and the Polish zloty. The exotic pair has relatively high volatility and rather low trading volumes.
symbol-description.currencies-usdrub: The USDRUB pair defines the ratio of the US dollar to the Russian ruble. It is characterized by a strong price movement that tends to trend for the medium to long-term.
symbol-description.currencies-usdsek: The USDSEK pair reflects the exchange rate between the US dollar and the Swedish krona. The pair is characterized by rather quick daily fluctuations and medium trading volumes.
symbol-description.currencies-usdsgd: The USDSGD currency pair quotes the exchange rate between the US dollar and the Signapore dollar. The pair is rather popular among the exotic class. USDSGD has medium levels of liquidity and high levels of volatility.
symbol-description.currencies-usdtry: The USDTRY defines the relationship between the US dollar and the Turkish lira. The currency pair has significantly high levels of volatility and strong intraday fluctuations.
symbol-description.currencies-usdzar: The USDZAR currency pair reflects the exchange rate of the US dollar to the African rand. The pair tends to move in a steady way with low liquidity as it generally forms well-defined trends for the medium to long-term.
symbol-description.currencies-xlmusd: Lumen is the native cryptocurrency for Stellar, which is an open-source blockchain payment system. Its competitive advantage lies in its fast processing time as the transfer of Lumens does not need approval from traditional crypto miners and so it enables Lumen to operate at a quicker rate than other blockchain-based systems. Stellar was founded by Jed Mc Caleb, a veteran in the crypto scene. He co-founded blockchain-based payment system Ripple labs as well as founded bitcoin exchange Mt. Gox.
symbol-description.currencies-xmrusd: XMRUSD is the exchange rate of Monero to US dollar. Launched in 2014, Monero is a cryptocurrency that allows for private and anonymous transactions. Monero is in the top 20 most valuable cryptocurrencies.
symbol-description.currencies-xrpusd: XRPUSD is the ratio of Ripple to US dollar. Founded in 2012, XRP is the currency that runs on the RippleNet digital payments platform. XRP is in the top 5 most valuable cryptocurrencies.
symbol-description.currencies-zecusd: ZECUSD represents the ratio between ZEC and the US dollar. Zcash (ZEC) is a cryptocurrency with a focus on privacy and anonymity. It is in the top 40 most valuable cryptocurrencies.
symbol-description.markets-aapl: Apple, Inc. is an American company founded in 1976 by Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak and Ronald Wayne. Apple designs, manufactures and sells a range of technology products. Famous for its iPhone, iMac and other devices, the company is worth over $2tn.
symbol-description.markets-adsgn: Adidas AG is a German company founded in 1949. It manufactures and sells products for the clothing industry, including shoes, clothes and accessories. Adidas is Europe's largest sportswear company.
symbol-description.markets-alvg: Allianz is a German mutinational company offering services in the financial industry. Its main fields of operation are insurance and asset management.
symbol-description.markets-amzn: Amazon is the absolute giant when it comes to the ecommerce sphere. It provides global sales through Amazon Web Services (AWS) for computing, storage, database, and corporate cloud services. The company does not pay dividends and share buybacks have been kept to a minimum in the past few years. This has a positive effect on liquidity. It is predicted that the AMZN stock price will keep climbing, going over $3000. Even though its price seems to keep rising, there is no stopping the king of e-commerce as Amazon is still named amongst one of the most innovative companies in the world by Forbes. The number of products sold keeps growing while the cloud division shows remarkable double-digit growth.
symbol-description.markets-ba: Boeing Co is an aerospace company founded in 1916. It engages in the manufacturing and selling of airplanes, rockets, satellites and telecommunications equipment. It is the world's largest aerospace company with a market cap of over $100bn.
symbol-description.markets-bac: Bank of America was created in 1998 by the purchasing of BankAmerica by NationsBank. Bank of America is a multinational investment bank headquartered in Charlotte, North Carolina.
symbol-description.markets-baygn: Bayer is one of the largest pharmaceutical companies globally. Founded in 1863 in Germany, Bayer is focused on research and development of healthcare and agriculture.
symbol-description.markets-bmwg: Bayerische Motoren Werke AG, or BMW, is German carmaker company founded in 1916. It manufactures and sells vehicles and motorcycles globally.
symbol-description.markets-bnpp: BNP Paribas is a French international banking group. It provides financial services to more than 72 countries and is the world's 8th largest bank by total assets. The bank has total assets worth over EUR2tn.
symbol-description.markets-c: Citigroup, Inc. or Citi is an investment bank founded in 1998 in New York, USA. It provides various financial services to a wide range of clients such as consumers, corporations and governments.
symbol-description.markets-copper: Copper is a commodity, traded around the world and useful in technology and the industrial infrastructure for its heat and electricity properties.
symbol-description.markets-csco: Cisco Systems, Inc. is a technology company founded in 1984 in San Francisco, USA. Cisco provides technology products and services including networking hardware, software and telecommunications equipment.
symbol-description.markets-cvx: A long-established integrated oil company, Chevron has primary business operations both upstream and downstream. It both explores and produces oil and natural gas as well as is involved in refining, marketing and transportation. As of March 2020, it ranked fifteenth in the Fortune 500 with a yearly revenue of $146.5 billion and market valuation of $136 billion.
symbol-description.markets-daign: Daimler AG, also known as Mercedes-Benz, is a German carmaker company. Daimler is one of the leading car and truck manufacturers with a global outreach.
symbol-description.markets-dollar: One of the strongest currencies around, the US dollar is used as a benchmark currency by traders to trade against given it is backed by the world's second-largest economy and the world's most used currency in transaction taking place all over the world. The U.S. Dollar Index (USDX) is the value of the US dollar in relation to a number of global currencies. It is used by forex traders internationally as a key indicator for the performance of the USD. The USDX consists of six foreign currencies: the Euro, Japanese Yen, British Pound, Canadian dollar, Swedish Krona and Swiss Franc. Keep in mind that this includes 24 countries in all given the Euro is used by 19 member states of the European Union and the countries the other currency is used for.
symbol-description.markets-esp35: IBEX 35 is the benchmark index of Spain. It consists of the top 35 publicly traded companies of Spain weighted by their market capitalization. Companies like Inditex, Banco Santander and BBVA are one of the leaders in the index.
symbol-description.markets-eustx50: Euro Stoxx 50 Index is comprised of 50 blue-chip companies, the best representation of different business sectors in 9 Eurozone countries, Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, the Netherlands and Spain.
symbol-description.markets-f: The Ford Motor Company was founded back in 1903 but was first traded on the New York Stock Exchange in 1956. With such a strong historical background it is no surprise that Ford stock is one of the strongest buys in the live market. It continues to innovate to this day, investing heavily in new technologies to be able to compete in the autonomous vehicles, ride sharing and electric cars' market.
symbol-description.markets-fb: Facebook, Inc. is an American social media conglomerate corporation based in Menlo Park, California. The social media company is definitely still growing despite the negative impacts of the coronavirus pandemic. The social media giant delivered strong revenue and earnings, sending its stock soaring 8% on the day following the announcement. However, the quarter results does not imply a blind move to invest. There is still much to consider before buying stocks. It holds major liquidity, and it is expected that revenue growth will bounce back in 2021. These factors make the Facebook stock a long-term investment option. Nonetheless, the global economy experienced a record contraction in GDP, and the company's revenue depends heavily on economic activity. In the short term, the economic downturn will probably impact its revenue but should Facebook continue to grow, this is probably the wrong time to pay a premium price for shares.
symbol-description.markets-fdx: Fedex Corporation is a delivery services company with a global exposure. It was founded in 1971 in Memphis and is now operating in more than 220 countries. FedEx is short for Federal Express.
symbol-description.markets-fra40: The CAC 40 index is a benchmark French stock market index. It represents the 40 most valuable publicly traded companies, among them LVMH, L'Oreal, Sanofi and BNP Paribas.
symbol-description.markets-ger30: The DAX represents 30 selected publicly traded blue-chip companies in the German economy. Among the companies are SAP at number one, Bayer, Siemens, Volkswagen and BMW.
symbol-description.markets-goog: A parent company of the American digital colossus Google, which has two listed share classes that use slightly different ticker symbols. GOOGL shares are its class-A shares, also known as common stock, which have the typical one-share-one-vote structure. Since both A and C shares have the same economic value, both expectedly trade in lockstep of each other and both trade with comparable volume and liquidity (an average of 2.3 million shares per day). A buy and hold stock by excellence for investors who are in it for the long term return. Google's dominance in the online advertising space should give its parent company strong revenue for the next decade, and Alphabet's pristine balance sheet ensures it will have the cash needed to invest in opportunities for growth and capital return.
symbol-description.markets-hp: Hewlett-Packard Enterprise Co is an American company that manufactures and sells technology and enterprise products and services such as printers, cameras, personal and business computers.
symbol-description.markets-ibe: Iberdrola is a Spanish electric utility company founded in 1992 in Bilbao, Spain. It offers electricity and gas services to more than 30 million customers.
symbol-description.markets-ibm: International Business Machines (IBM) is a technology company that specializes in the manufacturing and selling of server hardware, storage, software and cloud services.
symbol-description.markets-intc: Intel Corp. is a technology company founded in 1968 in the USA. It specializes in the manufacturing and the sales of computer products such as servers, processors and chipsets.
symbol-description.markets-jnj: Johnson & Johnson was founded in 1886 in the USA. It designs and sells products in the health care field. Its products are distributed to over 175 countries.
symbol-description.markets-jpm: JPMorgan Chase & Co is an American investment bank founded in 2000 in New York, USA. JPMorgan Chase is the largest bank in the United States and the 7th in the world by total assets. The bank has total assets worth over $3tn.
symbol-description.markets-ko: The Coca-Cola Company was founded in 1892 in the USA. It is a beverage coporation with a global exposure and sells nonalcoholic beverages, the most well-known of them being Coca-Cola.
symbol-description.markets-lvmh: LVMH Mo?t Hennessy Louis Vuitton or simply LVMH is a French conglomerate with focus on luxury goods. It is founded in 1987 and currently owns over 70 luxury brands.
symbol-description.markets-ma: Mastercard, Inc. is a financial services company that operates worldwide. Mastercard was founded in 1966 in the United States and is now one of the leaders in global payments.
symbol-description.markets-mcd: McDonald`s Corp is an American fast food company founded in 1940 by Richard and Maurice McDonald. It is now serving customers in over 100 countries and is known for its hamburgers, cheeseburgers and french fries.
symbol-description.markets-msft: Microsoft Corporation was founded in 1975 by Bill Gates and Paul Allen. Microsoft develops and supports software products, services and applications such as Windows OS, Microsoft 365. It also owns brands such as  Xbox and Linkedin.
symbol-description.markets-nas100: The Nasdaq is comprised of the top 100 technology companies in the USA. The Nasdaq 100 includes companies such as Apple, Microsot, Amazon and Facebook and is a sub-category of the Nasdaq Composite.
symbol-description.markets-nflx: Netflix, Inc. is a media services company founded by Reed Hastings and Marc Randolph in 1997 in the USA. It provides streaming services to over 195 million paid subscribers wordwide.
symbol-description.markets-ngas: Natural gas is a commodity that generally trades with high volatility and medium level of volumes. Natural gas is a popular commodity with many industrial and commercial applications.
symbol-description.markets-orcl: Oracle Corporation is a computer technology company founded in 1977 in the USA. The company manufactures and sells software and hardware products for personal and business use.
symbol-description.markets-pg: Procter & Gamble Company is a consumer goods company founded in 1837 by James Gamble and William Procter. It specializes in household products, consumer goods and personal care products and operates in over 80 countries.
symbol-description.markets-siegn: Siemens is a German conglomerate company founded in 1847. The company offers a diverse portfolio of products and services in the automation technology sector.
symbol-description.markets-spx500: The S&P500 or the Standard & Poor's 500 index is comprised of the top 500 publicly traded companies weighted by market capitalization. Apple, Microsoft and Amazon take the top 3 places.
symbol-description.markets-t: AT&T is the world's largest telecommunications company. Founded in 1983 in the USA, it provides mobile telephone services as well as media and technology services globally.
symbol-description.markets-tsla: Tesla, Inc. is an American carmaker company founded in 2003 and led by Elon Musk. It manufactures and sells a range of products including electric cars and solar products.
symbol-description.markets-uk100: The UK100 Index is described as a capitalistaion-weighted share index. Comprised by the top 100 companies that surround the London Stock Exchange and the largest market value. It is also known as "Footsie", and is considered to be the best representation of the UK Stock market.
symbol-description.markets-ukoil: Brent Crude Oil, also called UKOil, is a heavily traded commodity with large volumes and high volatility. It is sourced from the North Sea oilfields and is refined into diesel fuel and gasoline.
symbol-description.markets-us30: The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) is a benchmark US stock market index. It tracks the performance of 30 publicly traded large companies in the United States. The DJIA is one of the most important indicators of the state of the US stock market.
symbol-description.markets-us30-pro: The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) is a benchmark US stock market index. It tracks the performance of 30 publicly traded large companies in the United States. The DJIA is one of the most important indicators of the state of the US stock market.
symbol-description.markets-usoil: Crude Oil, also popular as West Texas Intermediate (WTI) or USOil, is a global commodity that trades with high daily volumes and high volatility. It is considered as the primary source of energy production.
symbol-description.markets-v: Visa is a financial services company founded in 1958 in the USA. It operates globally and is the world's largest retail electronic payments network.
symbol-description.markets-vowg-p: Volkswagen, or VW, is a German automaker founded in 1937. It manufactures and sells automobiles globally. It is the parent company of 12 brands, among them Audi, Bentley, Bugatti, Porsche and Lamborghini.
symbol-description.markets-xagusd: XAGUSD represents the ratio of Silver to US dollar. Silver is one of the most traded commodities in the markets. It reacts to news related to economic developments, monetary policy and other macroeconomic factors.
symbol-description.markets-xauusd: XAUUSD reflects the exchange rate of Gold to US dollar. Gold is the most traded metal and is regarded as a safe haven in the markets. Gold follows global macro developments and trades with high volatility and large volumes.
symbol-description.markets-xauusd-pro: XAUUSD reflects the exchange rate of Gold to US dollar. Gold is the most traded metal and is regarded as a safe haven in the markets. Gold follows global macro developments and trades with high volatility and large volumes.
symbol-description.markets-xauusd-t: XAUUSD reflects the exchange rate of Gold to US dollar. Gold is the most traded metal and is regarded as a safe haven in the markets. Gold follows global macro developments and trades with high volatility and large volumes.
symbol-description.markets-xom: Exxon Mobil Corporation is an American oil and gas company founded in 1999 in the USA. It specializes in the supply of oil and natural resources globally.
symbol-description.markets-xptusd: XPTUSD is the ratio of Platinum to US dollar. The platinum market is famous for its high volatility and large transaction volumes on a daily basis.
symbol-description.currencies-avausd: Designed to be scalable, Avalanche is on par with the top payment processors in the world (VISA and Paypal) and offers 4,500 transactions per second (TPS). Built with the aim of serving financial markets, it has great potential for its future. Its native token AVAX ensures high transaction security coupled with speed scaling a trillion per second. This coin is set to shake things up in the crypto industry with several traders choosing to jump in now that it is set to grow even further.
symbol-description.currencies-dotusd: The new kid on the block, Polkadot was created by Ethereum co-founder Gavin Wood. It was created with a different goal in mind, that of connecting and securing unique blockchains. This crypto's vision to Polkadot appears poised to continue its mission of developing a blockchain network that operates in a trustless fashion for verifying data and value transfers in its quest for a decentralized internet. Its recent price rallies, reaching new all-time highs saw investors profiting from this coin, solidifying its presence within the industry.
symbol-description.currencies-noksek: Pair represented by the Norwegian Krone and Swedish Krona. Different to other currencies and the Swiss krona in particular, the value of the Norwegian krone is often related to oil prices and interest rates. Meaning that when the oil price goes up, the krone strengthens its positions relative to other currencies and vice versa.
symbol-description.currencies-shbusd1000: Shiba Inu (SHIBUSD) is an Ethereum-based altcoin that was created way back in 2010 by an individual or group called Ryoshi. Widely regarded as the alternative to Dogecoin, it is created and hosted by the Ethereum blockchain. The coin's price has recently surged by x1000, giving it a market capitalization of $35 billion and ranking it 10th among all cryptocurrencies (as at end of October 2021). This makes it a very attractive usable asset due to its low entry point and possibilities for profitable returns.
symbol-description.currencies-solusd: Solana is one of the fastest growing cryptos found in the industry at the moment. This crypto, created in 2017, focuses on high-performing and fast transactions. In the year 2021, the coin has experienced monumental growth jumping from $1.50 in January 2021 to more than $208 (as at September 2021). It can handle more transactions per second than Ethereum, making its fees extremely low. All this continues to skyrocket its value higher, opening new benefits for Solana investors.
symbol-description.currencies-xptusd: XPTUSD is the ratio of Platinum to US dollar. The platinum market is famous for its high volatility and large transaction volumes on a daily basis.
symbol-description.markets-adausd: Cardano (ADA) is one of the fastest growing blockchain assets in the entire cryptocurrency industry. It stands out form other competing blockchains due to its use of mathematical principles in its consensus mechanism and a unique multi-layer architecture. Cardano's market capitalization has grown to over $66 billion. And is hailed as the Ethereum-killer. Traders have benefited from a good return on investment since it was launched in 2015.
symbol-description.markets-dax: The DAX is a stock market index consisting of the 40 major German blue chip companies trading on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange. It is a total return index. Prices are taken from the Xetra trading venue.
symbol-description.markets-jpn225: The Nikkei 225 is the index that is used to benchmark the Tokyo Stock Exchange and it has been calculated on a daily basis since 1950. This index is reviewed yearly and it encompasses the most prominent public Japanese companies across various sectors. Some notable examples include Panasonic Corp, Kawaski Heavy Industries, and Fujistu Ltd.
symbol-description.markets-mvrs: Meta Platforms, Inc., doing business as Meta and formerly known as Facebook, Inc., and TheFacebook, Inc., is an American multinational technology conglomerate based in Menlo Park, California. The company is the parent organization of Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, among other subsidiaries.
symbol-description.markets-vix: VIX stands as the Cboe Volatility Index, which calculates a real-time index to show the expected level of price fluctuation in the S&P 500 Index Options over the next 12 months. Known by many investors as the fear index.
symbol-description.markets-nas100-mini: This American stock market index tracks the securities performance of 100 of the largest non-financial companies that are listed on the NASDAQ. This index was established in 1985 and it is rebalanced once a year (every December). Some of the most prominent companies that are listed here include Amazon.com. Apple Inc., Adobe Inc., and eBay Inc.
symbol-description.markets-spx500-mini: The S&P 500 Index is a stock market index that tracks 500 large-scale companies listed on stock exchanges in the United States. This index was established in 1926 and since then has tracked the performance of the biggest companies. It currently features very prestigious names like Johnson & Johnson, Facebook, Apple Inc., and Microsoft.
symbol-description.markets-us30-mini: The Dow Jones Industrial Average is an index that gauges the performance of 30 large-scale companies that are present in the American stock exchanges. The index dates back to 1869 when it was created by the illustrious Charles Dow, the editor of the Wall Street Journal. Well-known companies that are present on this index include The Coca-Cola Company, Goldman Sachs, IBM, and McDonald's.
symbol-description.markets-dax-mini: The DAX is a stock market index consisting of the 40 major German blue chip companies trading on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange. It is a total return index. Prices are taken from the Xetra trading venue.
